abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed loan would support the
            Government's program of adjustment, with particular
            focus on improving the agricultural sector's prospects
            for efficient growth. More specifically, the reform program
            supported by the loan would: 1) improve the sector's
            incentives framework through rationalization of the import
            regime for agricultural commodities, reduction of
            generalized food subsidies, deregulation of the citrus and
            cocoa industries, and improvements in interest rate policy
            and related aspects of directed agricultural credit, 2)
            continue the process of divestment of public assets, and 3)
            establish the institutional basis for dealing with the
            improper use of pesticides. The loan would finance general
            imports subject to certain restrictions.
